intro: Marsdenia arfakensis, commonly known as the Arfakensis Marsdenia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asclepiadaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy surface. Its most distinctive feature is its clusters of small, fragrant, yellowish-green flowers that bloom during the rainy season. Marsdenia arfakensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
